question: Which of the following clearly defines the Factoring business?
option1: It is a type of debtor finance in which a business sells its accounts receivable .
option2: The receivables are sold to the third party (called a factor) at a discount.
option3: It is commonly referred to as accounts receivable factoring, invoice factoring.
explanation: Factoring is a financial transaction and a type of debtor finance. An entrepreneur will factor its receivable assets to meet its present and immediate cash needs.
